content.description: Climb the face ten feet left of Lorax (5.7)  on features and edges. Careful there is a seriously knarled bush to contend with at the start.

climbs.name: When You Wishon On a Star (The Cat With No Hat)

content.description: Climb up the corner/chimney, then traverse up and right to the anchor.
content.location: Shared anchor with "Sneeches on the Beaches"--the middle bolted face in-between this route and "Hop on Pop," which is the right facing corner on the right. These 3 routes are roughly in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Climb the arete formed by the right facing corner of Green Eggs & Ham. Step up and grab the flake while palming the arete. Good footwork on small crystals gets you to a stance on the flake. Stick clipping the first bolt would be suggested as the landing is uneven and surrounded by dead logs, limbs, and rocks. From the flake continue up the face using a knob on the arete and face features. Climb the face past a flake that takes a 1.5 - 2 inch Cam. Continue past another flake with a fixed piton, then a bolt and the anchor.
content.protection: A  medium cam (1.5 - 2") and two bolts.
content.location: The arete and face left of Green Eggs & Ham.

content.protection: draws, possible some pro to 2" if desired.
content.location: Shared anchor with "When You Wishon On a Star"--the corner/chimney to its left, and "Hop on Pop," which is the right facing corner to its right. These 3 routes are roughly in the middle of the wall.

content.description: climb the seam/crack thing that forms a mini left-facing corner to a stance, then up face.
content.location: right side of crag, just right of Grinch

content.description: Scramble onto the large rock leaning against the face. Climb knobs to reach the high first bolt. Continue through a bulge and mantle a long incut edge. Climb the featured face to the anchor. While the guidebook claims this is "a good first time lead practice face" a fall before clipping the first or second bolt would have serious consequences.
content.location: At a large block leaning against the face and ten feet right of Wishon On a Star.

content.description: Climb the right facing corner, then work up and left to the anchor.
content.location: Shared anchor with "Sneeches on the Beaches"--the bolted face immediately to its left, and "When You Wishon On a Star"--the corner/chimney left of Sneeches on the Beaches. These 3 routes are roughly in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Climb the left trending seam, then move right into a large depression. From the depression climb the face on egdes and features, passing one bolt, to the anchor.
content.location: close to the right side of the crag.

content.description: Climb the right facing corner. About midheight begin to lieback and continue to the top. The corner is surprisingly clean. Green Eggs and Ham could certainly benefit from having a dedicated anchor.
content.location: Right side of the Dr. Seuss Wall.

content.description: Step up onto the flake/blade of rock at the base to reach nice edges and the first bolt. Climb on positive edges and features to a large horizontal edge and a second bolt. Continue up the face on excellent edges and features past a horizontal and the anchor. Caution: The second bolt is quite high and a ground fall is possible from near the 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 6 bolts and a two bolt anchor with screwlinks. This is the only anchor on the Dr. Seuss Wall equipped to rappel.
content.location: Far right section of the Dr. Seuss Wall. From the left end of the wall it is easiest to find a path to the west onto level slabs and a nice walk along a fallen tree to avoid the hellish Manzanita along the base of the wall. Look for a large right facing corner which is Green Eggs & Ham (5.7). Free Range McHam is ten feet left of the corner.

climbs.name: 1 Fish 2 Fish Red Fish Blue Fish

content.description: Climb the face on small positive features, flakes, and edges to a shelf below a bulge. High step and pull the bulge on edges. Continue over two huge flakes that form horizontals to the anchor. The route trends somewhat left to right. Descend by rappelling "Free Range McHam."
content.protection: Five bolts and an optional #2 Camelot.
content.location: Fifteen feet right of Green Eggs & Ham.
